name: DisabilityStatusAssessment
title: Disability Status Assessment
description: Disability Status - Health and Human Services (HHS) panel [HHS.ACA Section 4302]
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of values represents a six item set of questions used in the (American Community Survey) ACS and other major surveys to measure disability. The question set defines disability from a functional perspective.),(Data Element Scope: Disability status code as defined by HHS on Oct. 31, 2011: final standards for data collection on race, ethnicity, sex, primary language and disability status, as required by Section 4302 of the Affordable Care Act.),(Inclusion Criteria: All disability status assessment questions in the Race, ethnicity, sex, primary language, disability - Health and Human Services (HHS) panel [HHS.ACA Section 4302]),(Exclusion Criteria: n/a)

concept.display: Are you deaf, or do you have serious difficulty hearing [HHS.ACA Section 4302]
Are you blind, or do you have serious difficulty seeing, even when wearing glasses [HHS.ACA Section 4302]
Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, do you have serious difficulty concentrating, remembering, or making decisions [HHS.ACA Section 4302]
Do you have serious difficulty walking or climbing stairs [HHS.ACA Section 4302]
Do you have difficulty dressing or bathing [HHS.ACA Section 4302]
Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, do you have difficulty doing errands alone such as visiting a physician's office or shopping [HHS.ACA Section 4302]
